p: Notably, we identified genes related to changes in erythrocyte differentiation that have not been well explored in previous studies. Compared to critical survivors, the non-survivors showed obvious activation of the erythrocyte differentiation pathway. Erythrocyte differentiation occurs in bone marrow, not peripheral blood. RBCs are reported to contain 8400 human genes, including erythrocyte differentiation genes [ 12]. The detected mRNAs in this study may be synthesized from previous processes of differentiations. Our results showed that dynamic changes in RBCs, rather than their overall level, may be an essential indicator of critical COVID-19 patient prognosis.
